title.narrative: 8.1 By 2018 be the leading voice for – and with – children with strategic and emotional storytelling, evidence-based messaging, and proactive and innovative communication to boost awareness of child r

description.narrative: UNICEF produced emotionally appealing videos and web stories with a strategic focus on becoming a leading voice for children. In 2019 the Country Office saw an 18 percent increase in social media followers ensuring that its ability to highlight progress for children and advocate for further support reaches a wide audience. UNICEF developed innovative approaches including engaging children to develop artistic expressions of the CRC@303, and developed the capacity for enhanced evidence-based messaging through the development of its Advocacy Pack, to be deployed in 2020 for the new Country Programme. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of returning users to UNICEF

target.value: 2019:At least 3 top asrtists engaged for advocacy and to reach their followers

actual.value: 2020:One thousand and thirty-five (1,035) young people viewed the CRC@30 song on YouTube
